title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: vignette demonstrates use PEITHO package manage, export, import, execute workflows. workflow system PEITHO allows define sequence steps (data fetching, processing, analysis), save share workflows zip files, re-import modify use. guide aimed users basic R knowledge, advanced R expertise required.

title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: Install PEITHO package GitHub already installed: devtools::install_github("Pandora-IsoMemo/PEITHO") Load package: development , may use devtools::load_all() instead library(PEITHO).

title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: can create workflow object files specifying path, use example workflow included PEITHO passing empty string path:
code: my_wf <- new_workflow(workflow_file_paths = workflow_file_paths(path = "")) ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Creating empty results.json file. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command simple_split for step 1 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command fetch_WebText for step 2 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command unlist for step 3 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command paste for step 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command paste for step 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command gsub for step 6 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command simple_split for step 7 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command simple_split for step 8 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command fetch_WebText for step 9 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command unlist for step 10 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command paste for step 11 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command paste for step 12 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Parsing command paste for step 13

what: Exporting a Workflow as a Zip File
title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: can export current workflow setup (relevant files) zip archive (.peitho extension):
code: zipfile_path <- "./examples/my_workflow.peitho" save_as_zip(my_wf, file = zipfile_path) ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Creating directory './examples' for saving zip file.

title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: execute workflow, use run() function. can specify steps run (e.g., step 1 5): running, can inspect results:
code: my_run_1 <- run(my_wf, from = 1, to = 5) ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Running step 1 of 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26]   Operation 'simple_split': 3 results ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:26] Running step 2 of 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29]   3 loop iterations for operation 'fetch_WebText': ## WARN [2026-02-12 08:01:29]      WARNING! Multiple results per iteration! Ensure that downstream steps handle list inputs. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29] Running step 3 of 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29]   3 loop iterations for operation 'unlist': ## WARN [2026-02-12 08:01:29]      WARNING! Multiple results per iteration! Ensure that downstream steps handle list inputs. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29] Running step 4 of 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29]   3 loop iterations for operation 'paste': ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29]      3 single results. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29] Running step 5 of 5 ## WARN [2026-02-12 08:01:29] WARNING! Detected list argument(s) for operation 'paste', but 'loop' is set to 'no'. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:29]   Operation 'paste': single result length(my_run_1$state$last_result) ## [1] 1 PEITHO:::trunc(my_run_1$state$last_result, n_char = 100) ## [1] "Main page---Contents---Current events---Random article---About Wikipedia---Contact us---Help---Learn ..."

what: Importing and Modifying a Workflow from a Zip File
title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: import workflow zip file, first define directory workflow files extracted. may also modify workflow steps (example, editing commands.json inputs.json extracted folder) running . can now run imported (possibly modified) workflow inspect results :
code: zipfile_path <- "./examples/my_workflow.peitho"  my_wf_imported <- PEITHO::import_workflow(   zipfile = zipfile_path,   extract_dir = "./examples/peitho_import" ) ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command simple_split for step 1 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command fetch_WebText for step 2 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command unlist for step 3 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command paste for step 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command paste for step 5 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command gsub for step 6 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command simple_split for step 7 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command simple_split for step 8 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command fetch_WebText for step 9 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command unlist for step 10 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command paste for step 11 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command paste for step 12 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Parsing command paste for step 13 my_run_2 <- run(my_wf_imported, from = 1, to = 4) ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Running step 1 of 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30]   Operation 'simple_split': 3 results ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:30] Running step 2 of 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32]   3 loop iterations for operation 'fetch_WebText': ## WARN [2026-02-12 08:01:32]      WARNING! Multiple results per iteration! Ensure that downstream steps handle list inputs. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32] Running step 3 of 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32]   3 loop iterations for operation 'unlist': ## WARN [2026-02-12 08:01:32]      WARNING! Multiple results per iteration! Ensure that downstream steps handle list inputs. ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32] Running step 4 of 4 ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32]   3 loop iterations for operation 'paste': ## INFO [2026-02-12 08:01:32]      3 single results. length(my_run_2$state$last_result) ## [1] 3 PEITHO:::trunc(my_run_2$state$last_result, n_char = 100) ## [1] "Main page---Contents---Current events---Random article---About Wikipedia---Contact us---Help---Learn ..., \\nMain page---Contents---Current events---Random article---About Wikipedia---Contact us---Help---Learn ..., \\nMain page---Contents---Current events---Random article---About Wikipedia---Contact us---Help---Learn ..."

title: Working with Workflows in PEITHO: Import, Export, and Execution
text: PEITHO’s workflow system allows : Load execute multi-step workflows configuration files Export workflows zip files sharing backup Import modify workflows zip files Inspect print results workflow execution makes easy share, reuse, adapt complex analysis pipelines reproducible way.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Antonia Runge. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Runge (2026). PEITHO: Workflow Management Reproducible Analysis R. R package version 26.02.2, https://pandora-isomemo.github.io/PEITHO/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PEITHO: Workflow Management and Reproducible Analysis in R},   author = {Antonia Runge},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 26.02.2},   url = {https://pandora-isomemo.github.io/PEITHO/}, }

text: Refer vignette description usage PEITHO package. can find Documentation .

title: Workflow Management and Reproducible Analysis in R
text: adding information help sites, docstrings vignette package, please update documentation locally follows. documentation main branch build automatically via github action.
code: devtools::document() # or CTRL + SHIFT + D in RStudio devtools::build_site()

what: Extract input values from a workflow run — extract_inputs
title: Extract input values from a workflow run — extract_inputs
text: function extracts user input values used workflow run.

title: Extract input values from a workflow run — extract_inputs
Extract input values from a workflow run — extract_inputs
text: wfr `workflowrun` object.

title: Extract input values from a workflow run — extract_inputs
text: named list input values.

what: Extract workflow steps from files in a folder — extract_workflow_from_files
title: Extract workflow steps from files in a folder — extract_workflow_from_files
text: Extract workflow steps files folder

title: Extract workflow steps from files in a folder — extract_workflow_from_files
Extract workflow steps from files in a folder — extract_workflow_from_files
text: workflow_file_paths list file paths workflow files (see `workflow_file_paths()`). Default package's `peitho_files` folder. show_functions_path Logical, whether show path loaded script file.

title: Extract workflow steps from files in a folder — extract_workflow_from_files
text: list `workflowstep` objects.

what: Fetch and parse web text from a URL — fetch_WebText
title: Fetch and parse web text from a URL — fetch_WebText
text: function retrieves HTML content specified URL, extracts text based provided CSS selector, returns `WebText` object containing extracted text metadata.

title: Fetch and parse web text from a URL — fetch_WebText
code: fetch_WebText(   url,   css_selector = "h1, h2, h3, p, li",   timeout_sec = 10,   user_agent = NULL,   return_text_blocks_only = TRUE )

title: Fetch and parse web text from a URL — fetch_WebText
text: url character string specifying URL fetch. css_selector character string specifying CSS selector identify text-containing HTML elements. Default `"h1, h2, h3, p, li"`. timeout_sec integer specifying timeout HTTP request seconds. Default `10`. user_agent optional character string specifying User-Agent header HTTP request. `NULL`, default User-Agent string used. return_text_blocks_only logical indicating whether return extracted text blocks character vector (`TRUE`), full `WebText` object metadata (`FALSE`). Default `TRUE`.

title: Fetch and parse web text from a URL — fetch_WebText
text: `WebText` object containing extracted text metadata.

what: Import workflow from a ZIP file — import_workflow
title: Import workflow from a ZIP file — import_workflow
text: Import workflow ZIP file

title: Import workflow from a ZIP file — import_workflow
Import workflow from a ZIP file — import_workflow
text: zipfile Path input ZIP file. extract_dir Directory extract workflow files .

title: Import workflow from a ZIP file — import_workflow
text: `workflow` object created extracted files.

text: WebText Class Represents text content fetched web page.

title: WebText Class Represents text content fetched from a web page. — new_WebText
code: new_WebText(   url,   title,   text_blocks,   fetched_at = Sys.time(),   status_code = NA_integer_,   warnings = character() )

title: WebText Class Represents text content fetched from a web page. — new_WebText
text: url Character string. URL web page. title Character string. title web page. text_blocks character vector. element represents block text extracted page. fetched_at POSIXct. timestamp content fetched. status_code Integer. HTTP status code request. warnings Character vector. warnings encountered fetching parsing.

what: Create a new operation parameter object — new_operationparam

title: Create a new operation parameter object — new_operationparam
code: new_operationparam(   step_id,   position,   name = NULL,   value = "",   label = "",   type = c("literal", "input", "result"),   loop = c("no", "yes", "auto"),   ... )

title: Create a new operation parameter object — new_operationparam
text: step_id ID step parameter belongs . position Integer position parameter argument list. name name parameter (default: `NULL` unnamed). value stored value parameter (default: ""). label human-readable label parameter (default: ""). type Type parameter. One : - "input"  : value comes user input external input - "result" : value refers previous step's result - "literal": value used -(literal argument) loop Looping behavior parameter. One : - ""   : loop - "yes"  : always loop - "auto" : automatically determine looping, loop input list else ... Additional metadata (optional).

title: Create a new operation parameter object — new_operationparam
text: `operationparam` object.

Additional metadata store workflow.

title: Create a new workflow step object — new_workflowstep

title: Create a new workflow step object — new_workflowstep
text: id integer identifier step. operation character string specifying name function execute step, e.g. "strsplit". function must exist loaded name space custom script environment. name human-readable name step. Defaults "Step <id>". label label step, used UIs. Defaults `name`. comments character string comments description step. params list parameters pass operation function. loop character string indicating step looped . Can "yes", "", "auto". env environment look operation function. Default parent frame. ... Additional metadata store step.

title: Create a new workflow step run object — new_workflowsteprun

Contains actual values used execution (e.g. results previous steps). output output produced step, successful. error error object step failed, otherwise `NULL`. ... Additional metadata store step run.

what: Helper to get file paths for PEITHO workflow files — workflow_file_paths
title: Helper to get file paths for PEITHO workflow files — workflow_file_paths
text: function constructs full file paths workflow files located specified folder. Validation file existence performed `extract_workflow_from_files()`.

title: Helper to get file paths for PEITHO workflow files — workflow_file_paths
code: workflow_file_paths(   path = "",   inputs = "",   commands = "",   results = "",   functions = "",   config_path = system.file("config", "config.json", package = "PEITHO") )

title: Helper to get file paths for PEITHO workflow files — workflow_file_paths
text: path Path folder containing workflow files (default: PEITHO example folder). inputs Name inputs file (default: "inputs.json"). commands Name commands file (default: "commands.json"). results Name results summary file (default: "results.json"). functions Name R script file containing custom functions (default: "functions.R"). config_path Path configuration JSON file (default: package's config.json).

title: Helper to get file paths for PEITHO workflow files — workflow_file_paths
text: list full paths specified files.

title: PEITHO 26.02.1
text: Fixed missing argument host startApplication() function, allowing specification host address starting Shiny app.

title: PEITHO 26.02.0
text: Introduced .data.frame() S3 methods workflows, workflow runs, workflow states, plus new extract_inputs() helper. Extended Shiny app build execute example workflow progress tracking tabular result views (#21).

title: PEITHO 26.01.3
text: Extended example workflow demonstrate sub-workflows, allowing sequential execution multiple workflow segments (#14) Sub-workflows can now reference results earlier steps explicitly, enabling complex, non-linear workflows. Improved logging loop execution, including clearer warnings operations produce list-type results.

title: PEITHO 26.01.3
text: Fixed bug result parameters always resolved last executed step, ignoring referenced step label. Workflow execution now uses cached state lookups resolve result parameters step name (ID), ensuring correct dependency handling across steps.

title: PEITHO 26.01.2
text: Converted warning informational message creating new results.json file yet exist.

title: PEITHO 26.01.1
text: Added import_workflow() streamline workflow import zip files. Updated vignettes examples use new import pattern.

title: PEITHO 26.01.0
text: Implemented export import workflows zip bundles, enabling workflow sharing reuse (#13). Added save_as_zip() generic workflow method exporting workflows zip files. Enhanced example workflow multi-step data processing (including unlist, paste, substitute, split operations). Added comprehensive vignette demonstrating workflow import/export capabilities.

title: PEITHO 25.12.0
text: Define, execute, track multi-step workflows New core classes: workflow, workflowstep, workflowstate, workflowsteprun, operationparam Robust workflow execution error handling result tracking Support file-based workflow configuration via JSON files

title: PEITHO 25.11.0
text: new WebText class representing fetched web content. fetch_WebText function retrieving parsing HTML URLs. Implemented comprehensive tests WebText class web text fetching functionality.
